update.description:
Use GNUInstallDirs instead of hardcore values for directories.

Similar migration [was done for gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/676/migrate-unix-directories-to-use/diff), and the [previous reasons](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo-release/issue/32/use-gnuinstalldirs-to-provide-file) also apply here.
update.title: Support for GNUInstallDirs

content.raw: It was not my intention to make all the possible changes that potentially break catkin. Indeed, we could make them only in the debian package, although it is not my preferred option. Feel free to start a mail discussion with the rest of the team so we could collect everyone's opinion.
content.html: It was not my intention to make all the possible changes that potentially break catkin. Indeed, we could make them only in the debian package, although it is not my preferred option. Feel free to start a mail discussion with the rest of the team so we could collect everyone's opinion.

content.raw:
We have not. We are still keeping the finder inside one the standard paths where cmake find_package is going to look for. See [find package documentation](http://www.cmake.org/cmake/help/v2.8.8/cmake.html#command%3afind_package). 

```
<prefix>/(lib/<arch>|lib|share)/cmake/<name>*/          (Unix)
<prefix>/(lib/<arch>|lib|share)/<name>*/                (Unix)
<prefix>/(lib/<arch>|lib|share)/<name>*/(cmake|CMake)/  (Unix)
```
content.html:

<prefix>/(lib/<arch>|lib|share)/cmake/<name>*/          (Unix)
<prefix>/(lib/<arch>|lib|share)/<name>*/                (Unix)
<prefix>/(lib/<arch>|lib|share)/<name>*/(cmake|CMake)/  (Unix)

content.raw:
I think it is installing the cmake files to the wrong location. My cmake config file is in:
~~~
lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/cmake/sdformat/SDFormatConfig.cmake
~~~
content.html:
I think it is installing the cmake files to the wrong location. My cmake config file is in:

lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/cmake/sdformat/SDFormatConfig.cmake

content.raw:
Thanks for the feedback. I agree with the 100% of your message. There is absolutely no point in installing things by default out of the standard paths and require manual configuration.

The point of support this ```<prefix>/lib/<platform>/``` is that is the new standard for Debian/Ubuntu (the main toolchain maintainer is the same) in order to support [Multiarch](https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MultiArch) (more information is available in [Debian](https://wiki.debian.org/Multiarch/). 

The toolchain, particularly the linker, has been prepared to work with this directories:
```
jrivero@quartz ~ $ cat /etc/ld.so.conf.d/x86_64-linux-gnu.conf 
# Multiarch support
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu
```
In a standard download, build, install, you will end up with a working application. No need more tuning. If you install gazebo using a different PREFIX, you will need to provide ```LD_LIBRARY_PATH``` probably in all cases except ```/usr/local``` (and this last one could depends on the distribution).

I see GNUInstallsDirs as a good wrapper to be path distribution agnostic at your level applications, and leave to it the handle on library paths.
content.html:
Thanks for the feedback. I agree with the 100% of your message. There is absolutely no point in installing things by default out of the standard paths and require manual configuration.

The point of support this <prefix>/lib/<platform>/ is that is the new standard for Debian/Ubuntu (the main toolchain maintainer is the same) in order to support Multiarch (more information is available in Debian.

The toolchain, particularly the linker, has been prepared to work with this directories:

jrivero@quartz ~ $ cat /etc/ld.so.conf.d/x86_64-linux-gnu.conf 
# Multiarch support
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu

In a standard download, build, install, you will end up with a working application. No need more tuning. If you install gazebo using a different PREFIX, you will need to provide LD_LIBRARY_PATH probably in all cases except /usr/local (and this last one could depends on the distribution).

I see GNUInstallsDirs as a good wrapper to be path distribution agnostic at your level applications, and leave to it the handle on library paths.

content.raw:
From my perspective, as a non-Ubuntu user or a Ubuntu user building gazebo from source and installing to somewhere other than `/usr`, I would expect to be able to download, build, and install gazebo from source with (optimally) no configuration.

If you make the GNUInstallDirs the default then it sounds like I would have to either disable it and/or add `<prefix>/lib/lib64` (or similar) to my `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`. To me, you would want to make installing from source as easy as possible. I think it is better to only require options when absolutely necessary but when they are necessary make the option such that it has to be enabled for the packaging use case, as they can be specified once in a control file.

Obviously this is just my opinion, I think what ever you decide will probably be fine.
content.html:
From my perspective, as a non-Ubuntu user or a Ubuntu user building gazebo from source and installing to somewhere other than /usr, I would expect to be able to download, build, and install gazebo from source with (optimally) no configuration.

If you make the GNUInstallDirs the default then it sounds like I would have to either disable it and/or add <prefix>/lib/lib64 (or similar) to my LD_LIBRARY_PATH. To me, you would want to make installing from source as easy as possible. I think it is better to only require options when absolutely necessary but when they are necessary make the option such that it has to be enabled for the packaging use case, as they can be specified once in a control file.

Obviously this is just my opinion, I think what ever you decide will probably be fine.

content.raw:
Sorry but I'm unable to see the reasons why someone being upstream/packager at the same time wants to have different paths when installing libraries from source or .debs.

I would say that the patch to support an option for not using GNUInstallDirs is very minimal, if you have a good use case, I don't have major problem to implement it.
content.html:
Sorry but I'm unable to see the reasons why someone being upstream/packager at the same time wants to have different paths when installing libraries from source or .debs.

I would say that the patch to support an option for not using GNUInstallDirs is very minimal, if you have a good use case, I don't have major problem to implement it.

content.raw:
I'll just file it as a ticket against catkin. I mentioned this when gazebo started using GNUInstallDirs, and they said we should only do that when building debs.

catkin can send cmake arguments, but I don't think we should bother with the complexity right now. Thanks for your feedback.
content.html:
I'll just file it as a ticket against catkin. I mentioned this when gazebo started using GNUInstallDirs, and they said we should only do that when building debs.

catkin can send cmake arguments, but I don't think we should bother with the complexity right now. Thanks for your feedback.

content.raw:
Multiarch support is in ubuntu since 11.04 and we are using a default (and recommended way) of installing things. So if you ask me, leaving catkin aside, we are doing the right thing. Even I would say that is the best path to place the files.

In my opinion:

* sdformat is not a ROS package, very few cases should make us not to follow the best of the standards available.
* Make a ticket against catkin to support default installation paths.
* I see no problem in implementing a cmake variable not to use GNUInstallDirs, but I would sleep better if we enable it by default.

Is there a way of sending catkin cmake arguments? 
The idea is: ```catkin_make -DENABLE_GNUINSTALLDIRS:=FALSE```
content.html:
Multiarch support is in ubuntu since 11.04 and we are using a default (and recommended way) of installing things. So if you ask me, leaving catkin aside, we are doing the right thing. Even I would say that is the best path to place the files.

In my opinion:

  • sdformat is not a ROS package, very few cases should make us not to follow the best of the standards available.
  • Make a ticket against catkin to support default installation paths.
  • I see no problem in implementing a cmake variable not to use GNUInstallDirs, but I would sleep better if we enable it by default.

Is there a way of sending catkin cmake arguments? The idea is: catkin_make -DENABLE_GNUINSTALLDIRS:=FALSE

content.raw:
Should we always install to the GNUInstallDirs or just do it for debs? Catkin doesn't currently setup the LD_LIBRARY_PATH for GNUInstallDirs; it just points to the parent `lib` folder. It would be easiest to build sdformat with catkin if use of GNUInstallDirs was optional, and off by default, mainly something used just for building debs.

Pro:

* simplify instructions for setting LD_LIBRARY_PATH with local installs from source
* support catkin

Con:

* increased complexity in our cmake

Supporting catkin may not be a priority right now, but I just wanted to mention it.
content.html:
Should we always install to the GNUInstallDirs or just do it for debs? Catkin doesn't currently setup the LD_LIBRARY_PATH for GNUInstallDirs; it just points to the parent lib folder. It would be easiest to build sdformat with catkin if use of GNUInstallDirs was optional, and off by default, mainly something used just for building debs.

Pro:

  • simplify instructions for setting LD_LIBRARY_PATH with local installs from source
  • support catkin

Con:

  • increased complexity in our cmake

Supporting catkin may not be a priority right now, but I just wanted to mention it.
